title: कोहरे से ट्रेनों की गति पर विराम, 8 घंटे तक लेट आ रहीं
text:
[Hindi News](/)[Local](/local/)[Mp](/local/mp/)[Sagar](/local/mp/sagar/)[Bina](/local/mp/sagar/bina/)- Fog Slows Down The Speed Of Trains, Trains Are Getting Delayed By 8 Hours
कोहरे से ट्रेनों की गति पर विराम, 8 घंटे तक लेट आ रहीं
बीना9 मिनट पहले
- कॉपी लिंक
बीना | तीन दिन लगातार कोहरा पड़ रहा है। गुरुवार को सीजन का सबसे घना कोहरा रहा। सुबह 10 बजे तक कोहरे के कारण दृश्यता 20 मीटर से कम थी। कोहरे की धुंध के कारण सड़क के साथ रेल यातायात भी प्रभावित रहा। दिल्ली की ओर से आने वाली कुशीनगर एक्सप्रेस डेढ़ घंटे, तु
.

author: Sean Greene
title: Northern lights provide colorful show over Delaware Thursday night | The Latest from WDEL News | wdel.com
text: A severe geomagnetic storm provided an exciting evening for Delawareans who saw a colorful show in the skies. A crisp, clear evening provided perfect viewing conditions for a coronal mass ejection that left the sun on October 8, and took two days to reach Earth. As of 7:37 p.m. Thursday, the Space Weather Prediction Center had issued a Severe Geomagnetic Storm Alert, saying that enough solar radiation for a G4 storm, out of a G5 scale. They could not rule out if it could become slightly stronger before wrapping up early Friday. The strength of the storm allowed the aurora borealis, or northern lights, to be viewed much further south than usual. Auroras are caused by electrons colliding with Earth's atmosphere , and through a series of reactions leads to energy being emmitted as light, similar to neon. Most aurora are 50-300 miles above the Earth's surface. There was a major event in early May that Delaware missed out on due to a series of rain storms. Typically, it might reach down to the New York/Pennsylvania border, but activity Thursday night was expected to work down into the Carolinas. The light show does come with a few catches, there is a chance for voltage control problems on the power grids, and potential issues with GPS technology when the disturbances are at their worst. According to the SWPC, the peak of the energy reached earth at 3 p.m. Thursday, but levels were still in the warning level after sunset. In Delaware Thursday, that means skyviewers saw pink, purple, and green hues, especially when seen through a camera lens. Usually, the peak viewing time for an aurora is between 10 p.m. - 2 a.m.

author: El Correo Gallego
title: O Foro Cívico, sobre Medicina: «Está en risco un modelo de excelencia»
text:
O Foro Cívico, sobre Medicina: «Está en risco un modelo de excelencia»
Rechaza a creación de novas facultades en Galicia | «Non está xustificada», sinalan
A posibilidade de que se leve a cabo unha descentralización da docencia de Medicina entre as tres universidades galegas segue a implicar rechazo entre os axentes sociais de Santiago, onde se atopa a actual e única facultade que imparte esta ciencia. En concreto, o Foro Cívico de Compostela, integrado por entidades e colectivos profesionais da cidade, mantivo este martes unha nova xuntanza para abordar esta cuestión. Así, todos os integrantes do Foro consideran que o intento de creación de novas facultades de Medicina en Galicia, «ademais de non terse acreditado a súa necesidade, estaría poñendo gravemente en risco un modelo de excelencia e prestixio internacionalmente recoñecido, como o é o da Facultade de Medicina da USC».
Neste sentido, o Foro Cívico quere destacar que a posta en marcha dunha nova facultade «non pode entenderse como un feito illado senón no marco dun ecosistema que a integra, que lle da cobertura e co que debe estar perfectamente aliñada».
Neste sentido, destacan que o conxunto formado pola Facultade de Medicina, «que se sitúa entre as mellores de España e conta con profesionais de recoñecido prestixio»; a de Farmacia, «recoñecida entre as cen mellores universidades do mundo polo ranking de Shanghai»; o Instituto de Investigación Sanitaria de Santiago (IDIS) e o Campus Vida, «onde se xera máis do 70% da investigación biomédica de Galicia»-; o Hospital Clínico de Santiago; o Centro Singular de Investigación en Medicina Molecular e Enfermidades Crónicas (CIMUS), «recoñecido como Unidade de Excelencia María de Maeztu», e o próximo centro de Protonterapia, entre outros, «crean un ecosistema sanitario e de investigación sen parangón e difícilmente replicable noutras cidades, o cal, permite, ademais, que a USC lidere a captación de recursos (máis de 50 millóns de euros anuais) nun mercado altamente competitivo, como é o da investigación facilitando, así, a xeración de novas patentes e a transferencia de coñecemento».
A maiores, o Foro Cívico entende que a creación de novos centros en Galicia «non está xustificada, nin desde o punto de vista dun uso eficiente dos recursos públicos e o aproveitamento das economías de escala nin, tampouco, desde o punto de vista dunha mellor calidade da ensinanza, cuestión non menor, se temos en conta que se está a falar da formación dos profesionais sanitarios do futuro».
Respecto ao punto de vista económico e de optimización dos recursos públicos, o Foro Cívico céntrase no sobrecusto que suporía a creación de dúas ou máis novas superestruturas, «o cal viría a sumarse ao déficit económico crónico que está a sufrir o sistema universitario galego».
Tamén destaca que a creación de outras facultades non implicaría máis prazas para estudantes deste grado, «pola necesidade de acompasar a oferta de prazas para estudantes que queren cursan os seus estudos de Medicina coa oferta de prazas MIR».
«Novas estructuras ineficientes e costosas»
Por outra banda, respecto da calidade da docencia, o Foro considera que a creación de novas facultades implica «comprometer os niveles de excelencia alcanzados na actualidade, diluíndos entre novas estructuras ineficientes e costosas, como xa está a suceder co sistema aeroportuario galego, polo que reitera a necesidade de respetar o acordo asinado no ano 2015, no que se recoñecía como a única Facultade de Medicina de Galicia, a de Santiago; sen prexuízo de seguir avanzando -como xa está a facer a USC- nunha prudente descentralización, na que, respetando as cotas de calidade na formación, se acade a mellor viabilidade funcional e económica dos estudos de Medicina».

author: Mariam Abdullahi
title: Using Traditional Deities for Swearing-in Ceremony Can Curb Corruption, Says Ifa Priest
text:
Ifayemi Elebuibon, an Ifa priest, believes that having public officials sworn in through traditional deities will significantly reduce corruption in the country.
While addressing the press in Osogbo on Thursday, Elebuibon emphasized that politicians, when administered oaths with deities like “Ogun” (the god of iron) and other traditional methods, would be deterred from engaging in corrupt practices.
He pointed out that politicians are often wary of the repercussions of breaking promises when sworn in with Ogun or other traditional means.
According to Elebuibon, the god of iron promptly delivers judgment upon anyone who fails to honor their commitments.
As the Araba of Osogbo, he expressed concern about the alarming level of corruption in the country, affecting various sectors of the economy and the general populace.
Elebuibon argued that the leniency of the Bible and the Qur’an, used in oath-taking by politicians, contributes to their misconduct.
He highlighted that unlike seeking forgiveness for sins committed, traditional deities such as the god of iron provide instant judgment, deterring individuals from wrongdoing.
Advocating for traditional oath-taking among politicians, the Ifa priest proposed that they should experience the consequences as a means to combat corruption.
In discussing the appointment of traditional rulers, Elebuibon, a distinguished advocate for culture, criticized the involvement of governors in the selection process.
He stressed that the selection of traditional rulers should be solely conducted by kingmakers, stating that governors’ interference undermines the tradition.
While acknowledging the government’s role in supporting traditional rulers financially, Elebuibon urged for non-interference in their selection processes to uphold the sanctity of the traditional institution.
